lines.content: Overall, a very useful tool which saves a lot of time.
Even when writing this file, Copilot generated suggestions to autocomplete the text, which accurately conveyed what I
Asked for help with improving the code quality.
Here are the improvements made when tested with Parser class:
* Used links in JavaDoc comment to reference related classes
* Replaced magic numbers and strings with named constants
* Used inline methods to reduce unnecessary code abstraction
* Added exception handling for errors that were not accounted for
* Enhanced error messages with more context-specific information
However, when introducing Copilot into the workflow as opposed to using it from the start, more brainpower is required
to understand the generated code and decide whether to integrate it into the existing codebase.
